content: corded crochet project bag by donna stubbs the fiber house materials cotton worsted weight yarn - suggested yarns queensland coastal cotton or plymouth fantasy naturale 2 skeins size h hook 100 nylon cord clothesline cord or similar locking stitch markers size bag measures approximately 15 high by 12 wide abbreviations chain chain st stitch single_crochet single_crochet beg beginning slip_stitch slip_stitch blo back loop only notes for bottom of bag place markers at beg of increase areas for body of bag place marker in 1st single_crochet of each round and move up each new round beginning with round 2 you will single_crochet around nylon cord on all remaining row bottom make a chain approximately 1 smaller than desired width of bag when stretched example began with 35 chain round 1 3 single_crochet in 2nd chain from hook pm in beg single_crochet single_crochet in each chain to 2nd to last chain 3 single_crochet in last chain place marker in 1st of the three st continue around by working in back loops of foundation chain single_crochet in each chain across join with a slip_stitch in beg single_crochet chain 1 do not turn round 2 holding nylon cord on top of st from round 1 and working single_crochet around cord *2 single_crochet in each of next 3 st replace marker in 1st st of increases single_crochet in each st to next marker repeat from * once more do not join continue working remaining rounds in a spiral round 3 * 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in next st 3 times moving marker to 1st st single_crochet in each st to next marker repeat from * once more round 4 * single_crochet in each of next 2 st 2 single_crochet in next st 3 times moving marker up to 1st st of increases single_crochet in each st to next marker repeat from * once more ©2023 donna stubbs the fiber house 146 coffeen ave sheridan wy 82801 307-673-0383 corded crochet project bag by donna stubbs the fiber house round 5 * 2 single_crochet in next st single_crochet in each of next 3 st 3 times moving marker up to 1st st of increases single_crochet to next marker repeat from * once more round 6 * single_crochet in each of next 4 st 2 single_crochet in next st 3 times moving marker up to 1st st of increases single_crochet to next marker repeat from * once more if bottom as not as wide as desired continue increasing 3 stitches at each end of bottom until bottom is desired width next round single_crochet in blo of each st around removing all markers except for beginning of round marker next and all subsequent rnds working in both loops single_crochet in each st around moving beg of round marker each round work until bag is approximately 12 or desired height handles lay bag flat place markers approximately 3 in from the edges on each side placing 4 markers count number of st between markers on each side single_crochet
